instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.CHGR_ACIN: What is CHGR_ACIN? CHGR_ACIN is a signal that is created by a voltage divider between the charger and ground that goes into the ISL6258, ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip that creates PPBUS_G3H. It is necessary for SMC_BC_ACOK & CHGR_ACOK to be present so that the onewire circuit is told to turn on & allow the SMC to speak to the charger..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, no power
threads.message:
Originally had a dead short in <CHIP>U5560</CHIP>, swapped it out.

Then <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR> was getting really hot, so I swapped it out.

Then <CAPACITOR>C7600</CAPACITOR> was blistering hot, so I swapped it out.

Now it gets sort of warm around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> but I can't tell where the heat is coming from.


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 1v


There is a short, I just can't work out where it is. Even with alcohol sprayed down, nothing shows up.

Maybe the issue is on the other side of the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, no power
threads.message:
Maybe the issue is on the other side of the board.

yes most likely because most water comes in by the fan or keyboard.....

check this first

green light on charger?
onewire?
<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> ?
ohm on pin 27/28 <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, no power
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Repairable, post: 22010"]Maybe the issue is on the other side of the board.

yes most likely because most water comes in by the fan or keyboard.....

check this first

green light on charger?
onewire?
<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> ?
ohm on pin 27/28 <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>

[/QUOTE]

Greenlight okay, 

<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>::2 = 0.8v actually.
It comes up as 3.4 else where (<CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR> & <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> eg.).

<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>::27/28 = 20.2ohms

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_ACIN</SIGNAL> needs to be around 4 volts if i am correct.

check <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR>

and stil check other side of the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, no power
threads.message:
I think it's <CHIP>U5560</CHIP> that's getting hot.

It has already been replaced.

<RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR> = 3.98v on both pins.

<RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR>::1 = 3.98 & <RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR>::2 = 0.08v, == 20kohms.

So something is pulling it low.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, no power
threads.message: Yeah no, high side FETs were shorted and I bet 1V05 got PPBUS straight to it. Pretty sure this is toast.
